page.title: 18HEALTH - BORDEAN HOUSE (1)
page.content:
Bordean House has two purposes: To cater for old female residents and cancer patients. The residents pay a fixed amount. The money for the cancer patients is raised in several ways: 1)three out of ten beds are paid for by the National Health Service. 2)The house has a registered charity number, and a considerable amount is raised by several fund raising activities such as fetes, sponsered walks etc. and street collections. 3)The cancer patients, themselves, normally contribute to the charity. Also, some money is donated by relatives of the deceased patients.
The residents have rooms to themselves which normally have running water. However, the cancer patients are normally two or more to a room. They all share a communal Dining Room.
